SEARCH
Package de.happybavarian07.coolstufflib.commandmanagement

Klasse CommandManagerRegistry

java.lang.Object
de.happybavarian07.coolstufflib.commandmanagement.CommandManagerRegistry
Alle implementierten Schnittstellen:
org.bukkit.command.CommandExecutor, org.bukkit.command.TabCompleter
public class CommandManagerRegistry extends Object implements org.bukkit.command.CommandExecutor, org.bukkit.command.TabCompleter

The CommandManagerRegistry class provides functionality for managing and registering command managers and commands within a JavaPlugin environment. It allows for commands to be registered, unregistered, and queried, as well as maintaining associations between commands and their respective managers.

This class offers reflection-based utilities for interacting with the internal structures of the Bukkit PluginManager and the command system, such as accessing private fields and handling known commands.

Key Features:

  • Registers and unregisters CommandManagers and associated commands.
  • Allows for query methods to check properties of commands and their managers, such as permission requirements, argument constraints, and subcommands.
  • Supports auto-registration of permissions and subcommands for CommandManagers.
  • Provides methods for handling command execution and tab completion efficiently.
  • Ensures the integrity of the registry by allowing toggling and checks of the registry's ready state.

Usage of the CommandManagerRegistry requires initializing the class with a JavaPlugin instance. Ensure that the registry is marked as ready before performing registration or query operations to avoid runtime exceptions.

Designed for advanced handling, this class assumes familiarity with Bukkit's Plugin and Command APIs, as well as Java's reflection mechanisms.

  • Konstruktordetails

    • CommandManagerRegistry

      public CommandManagerRegistry(org.bukkit.plugin.java.JavaPlugin plugin)
      Constructs a new CommandManagerRegistry instance.

      This constructor initializes the registry for managing command managers specific to the provided plugin instance.

      Parameter:
      plugin - The instance of the JavaPlugin this registry is associated with.

  • Methodendetails

    • unregisterCommand

      public static void unregisterCommand(org.bukkit.command.Command cmd)
      Removes a registered command from the server's command map.

      This method unregisters a command from the Bukkit command map, effectively disabling it. The command is also removed from related aliases, if they exist and are linked to the command. This can be useful for dynamically managing commands in a plugin-enabled environment.

      Please note that this method uses reflection to access private fields and internal structures of the Bukkit API. This approach might break with future updates or changes in the API and should be used with caution.

      Parameter:
      cmd - the command to be unregistered. This must be a valid and previously registered command on the server's command map.

    • register

      public boolean register(CommandManager cm)
      Registers a CommandManager instance with the CommandManagerRegistry.

      This method initializes the provided CommandManager, including its associated subcommands, registers the necessary permissions, and associates the command manager with the internal registry. It ensures that all required setup is complete and that the commands are available for execution.

      Note: This method will throw a RuntimeException if the registry is not ready for use. Additionally, if a null CommandManager or a duplicate command manager is passed, registration will fail, and false will be returned.



      • Pre-Init: The method calls SubCommand.preInit() for each subcommand associated with the CommandManager before registration.
      • Post-Init: After registration, SubCommand.postInit() is called for each subcommand. This ensures that subcommands are correctly initialized and ready for use.
      • Command Registration: The method registers the command with the server and sets the executor and tab completer. If the command is already registered, the method will unregister it and re-register it.
      • Permission Registration: If the command manager has auto-register permission enabled, the method will check if the permission already exists and add it if not.
      • Subcommand Setup: The method calls CommandManager.setup() to add subcommands to the command manager.
      • Subcommand Permission Registration: If a subcommand has auto-register permission enabled, the method will check if the permission already exists and add it if not.
      • Subcommand List: The method clears the subcommand list after registration to ensure a clean state.
      • Return: The method returns true if the registration is successful, false otherwise.
      Parameter:
      cm - the CommandManager instance to register. Must not be null.
      Gibt zurück:
      true if the registration is successful, false otherwise.

    • permissionExistsAlready

      public boolean permissionExistsAlready(org.bukkit.permissions.Permission permission)
      Checks if a given permission already exists in the set of permissions managed by Bukkit.

      Compares the name of the given permission with the names of the permissions currently registered with Bukkit's PluginManager. The comparison is case-insensitive.

      Parameter:
      permission - The Permission object to check for existence. Must not be null, and its name will be compared with existing permissions.
      Gibt zurück:
      true if a permission with the same name already exists, false otherwise.

    • unregister

      public void unregister(CommandManager cm)
      Unregisters a CommandManager from the CommandManagerRegistry. This will remove the associated commands and permissions from the server, as well as clear the sub-command list and the internal registry of the given CommandManager.

      Note: This method should only be used after ensuring the CommandManagerRegistry is ready by calling the appropriate start method. If the registry is not ready, this method will throw a RuntimeException.

      Parameter:
      cm - the CommandManager to unregister. If null or not registered, the method will terminate without performing any action.
      • Commands registered by the CommandManager will be unregistered from the server.
      • Permissions associated with the commands, both for main and sub-commands

    • unregisterAll

      public void unregisterAll()
      Unregisters all CommandManager instances currently registered in the registry.

      This method iterates over all CommandManager instances maintained by the registry and calls unregister(CommandManager) for each instance. It ensures a clean removal of all registered commands and their associated metadata.

      Important: This method requires that the registry is in a ready state. If the CommandManagerRegistry has not been initialized or the start method has not been called, an exception will be thrown.

      Throws:

      • RuntimeException - if this method is invoked before the registry is ready for use.

      Usage of this method is suitable for scenarios where a complete reset of the command registry is needed, such as during plugin shutdown or reloading processes.

    • getCommandManagers

      public Map<CommandManager,CommandData> getCommandManagers()
      Retrieves a map of CommandManager instances paired with their associated CommandData.

      This method provides access to the registered command managers and their corresponding data. It ensures that the CommandManagerRegistry (CMR) is ready before returning the map. If the CMR is not ready (i.e., the start method has not been called), a RuntimeException will be thrown.

      Gibt zurück:
      A Map<CommandManager, CommandData> containing the registered command managers and their associated command data.
      Löst aus:
      RuntimeException - if the CommandManagerRegistry is not ready.

    • getCommandManager

      public CommandManager getCommandManager(String commandName)
      Retrieves the CommandManager associated with the given command name.

      This method checks both the primary command name and any aliases associated with each CommandManager. If a match is found, the corresponding CommandManager is returned. If no match is found, null is returned.

      Parameter:
      commandName - the name of the command or an alias to search for. Must not be null.
      Gibt zurück:
      the CommandManager associated with the provided command name or null if no matching CommandManager is found.

    • isPlayerRequired

      public Boolean isPlayerRequired(CommandManager commandManager)
      Checks if the player is required to execute the commands managed by a specific CommandManager.

      This method retrieves the CommandData associated with the provided CommandManager and determines whether the command managed by the CommandManager requires a player as the sender.

      Parameter:
      commandManager - the CommandManager for which the player requirement status is being checked. Must not be null.
      Gibt zurück:
      true if a player is required to execute the commands for the specified CommandManager, false otherwise.

    • isOpRequired

      public Boolean isOpRequired(CommandManager commandManager)
      Determines if the specified CommandManager requires operator (op) permissions.

      This method checks if the given CommandManager instance has a registered CommandData and evaluates whether it is flagged as requiring operator permissions.

      Parameter:
      commandManager - the CommandManager instance to be checked. Must not be null.
      Gibt zurück:
      true if the given CommandManager requires operator (op) permissions; false otherwise.

    • allowOnlySubCommandArgsThatFitToSubArgs

      public Boolean allowOnlySubCommandArgsThatFitToSubArgs(CommandManager commandManager)
      Determines whether only sub-command arguments that match the defined sub-arguments are allowed for a given CommandManager.

      This method retrieves the CommandData associated with the specified CommandManager. If the associated CommandData is not found, this method returns false. Otherwise, it checks the setting for allowing only sub-command arguments that fit the sub-argument definitions and returns the result.

      Parameter:
      commandManager - the CommandManager whose sub-command argument allowance setting is to be retrieved.
      • Must be a valid and registered CommandManager.
      • Cannot be null.
      Gibt zurück:
      true if only sub-command arguments fitting the sub-argument definitions are allowed; false if otherwise or if no CommandData is associated

    • senderTypeSpecificSubArgs

      public boolean senderTypeSpecificSubArgs(CommandManager commandManager)
      Determines if the specified CommandManager's sub-arguments are specific to the sender type.

      This method retrieves the CommandData associated with the provided CommandManager. If no such mapping exists, it returns false. Otherwise, it delegates to the senderTypeSpecificSubArgs() method of the CommandData instance.

      Parameter:
      commandManager - the CommandManager whose sub-argument sender type specificity is being checked
      Gibt zurück:
      true if sub-arguments are specific to the sender type; false otherwise

    • minArgs

      public int minArgs(CommandManager commandManager)
      Retrieves the minimum number of arguments required for a specified CommandManager.

      This method fetches the CommandData associated with the given CommandManager. If no data exists for the provided CommandManager, the method will return 0. Otherwise, it returns the minimum number of arguments needed as defined in the associated CommandData.

      Parameter:
      commandManager - the CommandManager instance whose minimum argument requirement is to be retrieved. Must not be null to ensure reliable fetching.
      Gibt zurück:
      the minimum number of arguments required for the given CommandManager, or 0 if no CommandData exists for the supplied CommandManager.

    • maxArgs

      public int maxArgs(CommandManager commandManager)
      Retrieves the maximum number of arguments that a command managed by the given CommandManager can support.

      If the specified CommandManager is not registered or no associated data is found, this method returns Integer.MAX_VALUE.

      Parameter:
      commandManager - the CommandManager whose maximum argument count is being queried
      Gibt zurück:
      the maximum number of arguments the command can support, or Integer.MAX_VALUE if no data is associated with the provided CommandManager

    • getSubCommands

      public List<SubCommand> getSubCommands(String commandName)
      Retrieves the list of subcommands associated with the specified command name.

      This method queries the relevant CommandManager for the given command name and collects its subcommands.

      Parameter:
      commandName - the name of the command for which the subcommands are to be retrieved; must not be null.
      Gibt zurück:
      a List of SubCommand objects representing the subcommands of the specified command; an empty list is returned if the command has no subcommands or if no CommandManager matches the provided command name.

    • onCommand

      public boolean onCommand(@NotNull @NotNull org.bukkit.command.CommandSender sender, @NotNull @NotNull org.bukkit.command.Command cmd, @NotNull @NotNull String label, String[] args)
      Handles the execution of/** Handles the execution of a command by processing the provided Command, sender, and arguments.

      The method verifies the validity of the command, checks the argument count, sender type, and permissions required to execute the command. It delegates the execution to the appropriate CommandManager implementation and logs the result.

      Key actions performed by the method:

      • Checks if the command name matches any registered CommandManager instances.
      • Validates the argument count and sender's characteristics (e.g., being a player).
      • Ensures that the sender has the required permissions to execute the command.
      • Logs the success or failure of the command execution to the system log.
      • Handles any exceptions that may occur during command execution by logging detailed error information.
      Angegeben von:
      onCommand in Schnittstelle org.bukkit.command.CommandExecutor
      Parameter:
      sender - The entity issuing the command. This could be a Player or a console (non-player entity).
      cmd - The Command being executed.
      label - The command label or alias used by the sender.
      args - An array of String representing the arguments passed along with the command.
      Gibt zurück:
      true if the command execution was successful, false otherwise. Returning true indicates that the command was handled and no further processing is required by the server.

    • onTabComplete

      @Nullable public @Nullable List<String> onTabComplete(@NotNull @NotNull org.bukkit.command.CommandSender sender, @NotNull @NotNull org.bukkit.command.Command cmd, @NotNull @NotNull String label, String[] args)
      Handles tab-completion for commands executed by a CommandSender.

      This method attempts to provide a list of valid tab-completion options based on the provided arguments and the specific CommandManager registered for the command. If the sender does not meet certain requirements (e.g., the sender is not a Player and the command requires a player), an empty list will be returned.

      In case of any internal errors during tab-completion, an appropriate message will be logged.

      Angegeben von:
      onTabComplete in Schnittstelle org.bukkit.command.TabCompleter
      Parameter:
      sender - the CommandSender who is attempting to execute the command. This can be a Player, the console, or another entity.
      cmd - the Command object representing the executed command.
      label - the alias of the command used by the sender.
      args - an array of String representing the arguments provided by the sender. This may be used to determine the appropriate tab-completion suggestions.
      Gibt zurück:
      a List of String containing possible tab-completion options based

    • isCommandManagerRegistryReady

      public boolean isCommandManagerRegistryReady()
      Checks whether the command manager registry is ready.

      This method determines if the registry of command managers has been properly set up and is in a ready state. It is essential for ensuring that commands and their respective managers can function without issues.

      Gibt zurück:
      true if the command manager registry is ready; false otherwise.

    • setCommandManagerRegistryReady

      public void setCommandManagerRegistryReady(boolean cmrReady)
      Sets the readiness status of the CommandManagerRegistry.

      This method updates the commandManagerRegistryReady field to reflect whether the CommandManagerRegistry is ready for use or not.

      Parameter:
      cmrReady - A boolean indicating whether the CommandManagerRegistry is ready.
      • If true, the registry is marked as ready.
      • If false, the registry is marked as not ready.

    • setLanguageManager

      public void setLanguageManager(LanguageManager lgm)
      Sets the LanguageManager instance for this CommandManagerRegistry.

      This method assigns the provided LanguageManager object to be used for handling language-related functionalities in the CommandManagerRegistry. The LanguageManager is responsible for managing translations, messages, or other localized content necessary for commands.

      Calling this method allows customization of language management within this registry by setting the specific LanguageManager implementation as needed.

      Parameter:
      lgm - the LanguageManager instance to be set. It should not be null and must be properly configured for managing desired language-related functionalities.

    • getPlugin

      public org.bukkit.plugin.java.JavaPlugin getPlugin()
      Retrieves the instance of the JavaPlugin associated with the CommandManagerRegistry.

      This method is useful to obtain the plugin instance that this class operates on.

      Gibt zurück:
      the JavaPlugin instance associated with the CommandManagerRegistry.
